channel.title: AIO Code Generator [BETA release]
channel.description:
[b]Hey guys, after several weeks of what has been a combination of sheer determination, luck and perseverance, I've completed my AIO Code generator worthy enough of a BETA release to the community :)
This has been designed to work with the major versions of private servers (317, 508 and 614) There is a tab for each individual one as the code differs universally.
This application is designed to make tedious coding tasks relatively simpler; it is capable of doing the following:[/b]
[b] * Basic command generation * Basic switch statements * Create shops from scratch * Npc dialogue (not yet perfected on 614) * Coordinate Zoning (My favourite) * Token strings[/b]
[b]I have had a considerable amount of help from various people for the gathering of many variables etc.. to add in, so respectively I shall make a credits list for this primitive release.
Credits:- 60% To myself for the intensive coding, devotion and idealism to this project. 30% To those who assisted me with miscellaneous snippets throughout the project and tips for a polished GUI. 10% To the language of C++ itself; without it, we'd all be screwed ;)
I hope that you enjoy this as much as I have, it feels nice to give something back to such a great community. Feedback is encouraged on any bugs you may discover; it is in BETA stage still, and any feedback to build on it for a better release is much coveted <3[/b] [b] You may download it [url=http://google.com]HERE[/url] Enjoy! :)[/b]

item.title: AIO Code Generator [BETA release]
item.dc:creator: @RB9 RB9
item.description:
@RB9 wrote:

[b]Hey guys, after several weeks of what has been a combination of sheer determination, luck and perseverance, I’ve completed my AIO Code generator worthy enough of a BETA release to the community

This has been designed to work with the major versions of private servers (317, 508 and 614) There is a tab for each individual one as the code differs universally.

This application is designed to make tedious coding tasks relatively simpler; it is capable of doing the following:[/b]

[b]

  • Basic command generation
  • Basic switch statements
  • Create shops from scratch
  • Npc dialogue (not yet perfected on 614)
  • Coordinate Zoning (My favourite)
  • Token strings[/b]

[b]I have had a considerable amount of help from various people for the gathering of many variables etc… to add in, so respectively I shall make a credits list for this primitive release.

Credits:-
60% To myself for the intensive coding, devotion and idealism to this project.
30% To those who assisted me with miscellaneous snippets throughout the project and tips for a polished GUI.
10% To the language of C++ itself; without it, we’d all be screwed

I hope that you enjoy this as much as I have, it feels nice to give something back to such a great community.
Feedback is encouraged on any bugs you may discover; it is in BETA stage still, and any feedback to build on it for a better release is much coveted <3[/b]

You may download it HERE
Enjoy!
